title: Did Rambo: Last Blood really end the journey of John Rambo? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am the author of a fully legal (and somewhat succeffull), unofficial Rambo prequel. With time my community grew so much that when I ended up watching LAST BLOOD I (sadly) knew all of the plot in detail and that was before the film was even released. Every info I received before time was (sadly) right. And I am saying ‘sadly’ because me (just like anyone else in the world) don’t enjoy reading spoilers before watching ANY film. Anyway, this premise was just to explain you why I receive so many rumours about Rambo and Stallone and that often. Original question: “Did Rambo: Last Blood really end the journey of John Rambo?” Your answer is… It’s up to Sylvester Stallone.  SPOILERS ALERT! According to rumors, after the trailer of LAST BLOOD was showed at the CANNES films festival, Stallone re-opened the set in order to shoot some extra scenes for the film and changing it’s ending in particular. According to those rumors again, the film’s ending was changed in order to make a sequel ‘possible’. In other words, Rambo was meant to die at the end of Last Blood, but Stallone changed the film in order to let the door open to a possible sequel after seeing how well the trailer was received at Cannes. As matter of facts and if you think about it, the ending titles sequence of RAMBO LAST BLOOD makes much more sense if the character died, but he didn’t. He survived. THAT SAID… On a financial level, Last Blood wasn’t THAT successfull… It was barely ‘okay’. On a critics level, it was a disaster… But that’s okay. It was okay for massive hits like Rocky 4, hence it doesn’t really matters. On public level… It polarized the public. Regarding the fans of the character… It was a hit and miss, and I think that this is what hurt Stallone the most. Many fans enjoyed it, but many others didn’t. And what’s even worse than that, everyone agrees that this is the lesser entry of the saga. Now Stallone is a pretty fair guy and fully capable of accepting a defeat, and in some interviews he admitted that the film could ‘have been better’ or said other similar phrases while talking about it. He had always accepted the public response in the past, and I think this time he did no exception to his rule. He makes film for the others to enjoy, not for himself. IN CONCLUSION: Stallone did Rocky Balboa and John Rambo in 2008 in order to make ‘one last big hit’. And even more than that, he was not happy with both Rocky 5 and Rambo 3, hence he did those two film back in 2008 in order to somewhat ‘repair’ the legacy of his two most beloved characters.. I am quite sure Stallone is not happy by the way LAST BLOOD was received compared to JOHN RAMBO. I have no doubts he would like to set things ‘straight’ once again. YET… It’s very hard he will ever find producers for another Rambo film again. Many professionals think he has no excuse for both the gross LAST BLOOD made (considering how famous the brand was) and the public’s reception. Will he try? Sure. Of course he will try. But will he ever do another Rambo one again and for real? Nobody knows. POST SCRIPTUM There are ‘entirely unconfirmed’ rumours about the plot of ‘Rambo six’. It would be about a dying Rambo being helped up by Indians living nearby, and being carried in an Indian reservation for treating his wounds. At this point and being the Indian reservation out of government control, Rambo would have troubles with the government of the US trying to figure aout what the hell happened between him and the drug cartels. This would be the beginning point of the plot. But if this film will ever be done, and if this is going to be it’s plot for real… This is extremely soon to say. And if you ask me, I think Stallone is pretty done with the character because of two reasons: financial reasons, and the way Hollywood works.
